techmeme.title: Sonos CEO Patrick Spence apologizes for the new Sonos app, launched in May with a criticized redesign, and promises biweekly app updates through the fall (Chris Welch/The Verge)
OpenAI says it partnered with publishers including WSJ and The Atlantic to build its search engine SearchGPT; publishers can manage how their content appears (Deepa Seetharaman/Wall Street Journal)
Meta says WhatsApp now has more than 100M MAUs in the US and that more than 50% of WhatsApp users in the country have an iPhone; WhatsApp has 2B+ MAUs globally (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
OpenAI unveils SearchGPT, a search tool powered by GPT-4 that can organize links and summarize its findings, available as a prototype to 10,000 users at launch (Kylie Robison/The Verge)
California's Supreme Court upholds Prop 22, allowing Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, and other companies to keep classifying California drivers as independent contractors (Maia Spoto/Bloomberg)
